windows.symptom: VPN and Windows 10        Hi! I have a strange issue with my Windows.I have a VPN-subscription, and I use the application I got from the VPN-provider, because the built-in VPN option in Windows is absolute worthless.Since I am using it, the system tray icon says no internet, but my internet working even better than before. Also my Outlook app is unable to download my mails, I have to use the web interface of Outlook in my browser.Whenever I open the Microsoft Store, I get the message 'It doesn't look like you are connected to the internet. Check your connection and try again.', and an error code: 0x800704cfWhy does the Windows Store and the Outlook app not working properly, when everything else does?
solutions: Build in VPN in Windows required VPN server and is an interface to communicate with server and it works quick good but it doesn't provide functionality which you required, so call it worthless is unfair.You are using third-party VPN program to connect to another country with VPN server , is that correct?In some cases, the destination server won't support some websites or protocols.In such case, you will need to check with VPN provider.

Hi, donald421 My name is Jeffrey and I am an Independent Advisor. I would be happy to help you today.Follow these steps to repair the Microsoft Store and Apps: 1) launch powershell 2) Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted You have to select (Yes to All) 3) Get-AppXPackage -AllUsers | Foreach {Add-AppxPackage -DisableDevelopmentMode -Register "$($_.InstallLocation)\AppXManifest.xml"}Restart your system Check the link to better understand how to execute the commands: https://www.digitalcitizen.life/how-reinstall-a...You can also download this application to try to repair the Microsoft Store. http://aka.ms/diag_apps10You can also reset the Microsoft Store https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/15057-clear...Note: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.

windows.symptom: Windows 10 Home Product Key        I installed Windows 10 online and it loaded as Pro but I have a Home product key. Microsoft told me to reinstall windows 10 Home from the USB I purchased and that it would change to Home. Well it hasn't. I still show running Pro but only have a product key for home. It hasn't asked me for an activation key. Confused on what to do and could use some help. Thanks
solutions: Hi Thomas, I am Sumit, an Independent Advisor and a 3 year Windows Insider MVP here to help.To downgrade to Windows 10 Home, a reinstall is required. Technically you should be prompted for which edition of Windows to install. Didn't it ask?I suggest downloading ei.cfg file for home and paste it into Sources folder of the flash drive to force Install Windows 10 Home.How to force Windows 10 Installation media to install a desired version? https://www.yourwindowsguide.com/2018/06/force-...How to do a clean install https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/insider/for...https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/for...

Did you boot from the USB media and select Custom install then delete all existing partitions. This is a clean install otherwise you can't "downgrade" from Pro to Home.All files will be removed so backup any personal files first.

windows.symptom: If i try to install minecraft windows 10 it shows this message.        So before i used to own minecraft windows 10 on another computer and so im trying to download minecraft windows 10 for the past few days and heres what it says :https://prnt.sc/qmaftfAnd also this :https://prnt.sc/qmai2rThanks for reading and i guess if you do answer also thanks :DAny answer would be appreciated.And yes i  am on windows 10 and everything is fine on my computer i checked everything.
solutions: Hi, The latest version of Minecraft requires build 1903 at least released last year. Your current build is 1511, released in 2015 hence the issue. Please go to https://www.microsoft.com/en-in/software-download/windows10 And choose update this PC. Follow the on screen instructions which should install the latest release. Let us know how that goes.

Thank you for that information. As per checking the system requirements for the game it requires a windows 10 build version of 17134.0 whereas you are currently on the 1511 version of build number 10586.I would recommend performing a windows update for you to be able to install Minecraft for windows 10.I've attached the game's system requirements as a reference. Let me know how it goes. :)

windows.symptom: windows powershell can I remove it?        How do I remove windows powershell? It tkaes forever to sign in! I really hate this thing!
solutions: The PowerShell has nothing to do with signing in to windows. Just don't use PowerShell if you don't want to, you can change it to the old Command Prompt if you wish.Setting >  Personalisation and select Taskbar see the setting to replace the command prompt with PowerShell, toggle off for the old command prompt.If this is not what you mean then explain more please.

Hi my name is Ross, I'm an independent advisor. I'd be happy to help with your issue.Powershell is a crucial component of the operating system, so unfortunately you can’t remove it. What are you trying to do that is taking a long time with Powershell?Regards, Ross

When I upgraded to Windows 10 i got a random Blue Screen. My PC restarted i opened Task Manager and there it is 100% CPU Usage non-stop. Its really annoying i read the same problem of some guy on this kinda forum, and followed his steps. None of them worked and i'm really annoyed by Windows 10. This never happened on Windows 7 and i'm really hoping there is a way to fix this.My PC:CPU: Intel Core i5 2400 3,10GHzRAM:12GB(4x3)Graphics Card: Nvidia Geforce GTX 1050 Ti 4GB GDDR5HDD:1TBI am waiting for help.
Memory Usage problem, can anyone please tell me how to fix it?        can anyone please help me, i'm getting that problem since i first update my window
solutions: Hi Kanwar, I am Sumit, an Independent Advisor and a 3 year Windows Insider MVP here to help.It looks like Windows Defender is scanning your device continuously - one of the reasons might be disk corruption.How to do a Disk check of System drive in Windows 10 and interpret the logs https://www.yourwindowsguide.com/2018/04/how-to...If the log looks clean you may check the answer marked here. https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/for...Word of caution - Disabling periodic scan might pose a security risk. Content on the above blog is written by a Microsoft MVP so it is safe. However, do watch out for the ads.

Microsoft account login password error        I just got a new computer. I am unable to register this device with my Microsoft account or use it to log into Microsoft because while it accepts my correct password at the first stage, it always claims my password is incorrect at the next stage when it prompts me to enter my password "one last time". I have made sure over dozen of tries that I am entering my password correctly, the same way, both times. I have changed my password to make absolute sure I know what it is.I got to Settings > Accounts > Your Info > Sign in with a Microsoft account instead. First step, enter email address. Accepted. Second step, enter password. Accepted. Then, this prompt:Sign into this computer using your Microsoft accountNext time you sign into this computer, use your Microsoft account password or, if you've set it up, your PIN or Windows Hello.We'll need your current Windows password one last time.The password you entered for your device is incorrect. Please try again.No matter what I do, it always claims my correct password is incorrect. Please help!
solutions: Hi Laura. I'm Greg, an installation specialist and 9 year Windows MVP, here to help you.How about trying to change the password? https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/402697...If not possible then user Microsoft Account Recovery to reset password: https://support.microsoft.com/te-in/help/17875/...I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and let us know how it goes. I will keep working with you until it's resolved.______________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.
Hello, On the 'We'll need your current Windows password one last time' screen, you need to enter your local account password, not Microsoft account password.Hope this helps!

I am having this issue and was wondering where I would find my local account password I only know my password I have for my email and xboxalso if you mean the password you set to log into your pc I dont have one the pc is new and I did not set it yet
I had the same problem. I finally figured it out 2 hours later on my own. try leaving local password blank.
Hello, On the 'We'll need your current Windows password one last time' screen, you need to enter your local account password, not Microsoft account password.Hope this helps! Thank you so much!
I had the same problem. I finally figured it out 2 hours later on my own. try leaving local password blank.Thank you. This worked for me.
Thank you Luthifer, you are the boss
I had the same problem. I finally figured it out 2 hours later on my own. try leaving local password blank.I let it blank and it works for me, thank you

windows.symptom: windows 10 installation has failed        im updating from win10 1703 to 1909 after i downloaded win10 1909 an error occured and it says "windows 10 installation has failed"my pc specs i7 7700hq gtx 1060 16gb ram
solutions: Hi marwan, I am Sumit, an Independent Advisor and a 3 year Windows Insider MVP here to help.Let us check the Installation log to find why the update failed. Please share the logs as mentioned in this article. You should use a File sharing service like Onedrive or Media Fire to upload files and share the link in the next reply.https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/for...The Panther logs. Files named Setupact.log and Setuperr.log from the following path C:\$Windows.~BT\Sources\PantherThe Rollback logs: These usually are created if Windows Update rolls back. Files named Setupact.log and Setuperr.log from the following path C:\$Windows.~BT\Sources\Rollback[Only if the error code is 0xC1900101-0x30018] The Device Install Log from C:/$Windows.~bt\Sources\Rollback\setupapi\setupapi.dev.logAs the log size might be large consider zipping before uploading.

windows.symptom: windows 7        Several years ago my computer upgraded itself to windows 10 from windows 7. Things went fine for awhile but then I could not boot up the computer and had to do a revert to get it to reboot. Is this going to happen again if I upgrade it again? I can't afford a new computer at this time.
solutions: We don't know if it will happen again.We don't work for Microsoft.The free upgrade to 10 is yours for the life of that device.The best method to upgrade back to 10 is to clean install it.Use the Windows 10 media creation tool on the Software download page "Start fresh with a clean installation of Windows 10"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-download/windows10startfreshReinstall Windows 10:https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/4000735/windows-10-reinstall"How to Clean Install Windows 10"http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/1950-windows-10-clean-install.html_______________________________________________How to Create Bootable USB Flash Drive to Install Windows 10 fromThis tutorial will show you how to create a bootable USB flash drive that can be used to installWindows 10 with or without UEFI.________________________________________________To access BIOS/UEFI - UEFI/EFI configuration:https://neosmart.net/wiki/boot-usb-drive/_____________________________________When your free upgrade to 10 was  originally activated Microsoft will have kept the Hardware Configuration details of your device on their Servers for recognition purposes if you have to reinstall 10."Activation in Windows 10" (Digital entitlement)https://support.microsoft.com/en-au/help/12440/windows-10-activation

windows.symptom: received a faulty ssd, installed new win10 software. When the new drive arrives, will I be able to install again with same product code?        Bad ssd
solutions: Hi, My name is Gary an independent advisor and I would be happy to help you out with your concern,First, you'd need to identify if the product key for the windows 10 computer is either a retail or an OEM key.Normally OEM keys are solely embedded to one motherboard as they do not have transfer rights for other hardware, unlike retail keys which has transfer rights.For free upgrade licenses, the condition for these are relevant to an OEM key as the license is then considered a digital license once you upgraded free to windows 10.Under this link are reference to activation after hardware change https://support.microsoft.com/en-ph/help/20530/...For your windows 10 license, I'd recommend running the activation troubleshooter on the new ssd with the same motherboard. Go to Settings>Update and security>Activation and run the troubleshooter. and select I recently changed hardware on this device.If the troubleshooter hasn't helped, you would have to call Microsoft during support hours to get more help.https://support.microsoft.com/en-in/help/405170...

If all you are changing is the SSD then you should be able to install Windows 10 using the same licence on new storage.The licence agreement allows OEM or Retail to be installed on original or new storage as many times as you require. The licence is registered against the motherboard for activation purposes.
